content.description: Classic of the area, low start, 2 hands on side pull. Work your way straight up through sharp crimps. Big moves are needed, explosive precision.
content.protection: We used 2 pads but would have preferred 1 or 2 more for peace of mind.
content.location: Far side of the whole thing, over hanging wall with small spire behind it.

content.description: Overall pretty smooth and easy route,. Great lookout at the top, good warmup.
content.location: Start is at the obvious base of the huge slab, Next to the overhanging face, far side of the formation.

content.description: Start on the same start holds as Lizard King, head to the left until a chunk sticks out in a straight wall, quite a few feet over. Then go up that for the top out. Personal preference is to go through the top middle, but can also take the low route.
content.protection: 2 pads needed or one great spotter to keep moving 1.
content.location: Same start as Lizard king then go to the left. Aka, right side around corner side pull and low left side pocket or crimp.

content.description: Start low on the left side pull and a right side pull around the corner, then mover up through the pockets and crimps and top up straight above the left start hold or so.
content.location: Front of the area, right of the blue graffiti near the ground.

content.description: Very secluded, beautiful area, perfect rock.
